page.title: 20GAELIC
page.content: In our part of the country,Gaelic is seen as a living language which takes its place on the school curriculum. At the Primary school stage we learn 'conversational' Gaelic while in the Secondary study is taken to S.C.E. level. For many pupils the annual local gathering to celebrate the Gaelic language and culture - the Mod -is the culmination of many weeks work, musically and orally. It is the one occasion when the tartans are shown in all their splendour. Success in the local Mod leads to competing at the National Mod which has a different venue every year in northern Scotland.
